content: Edit this paragraph about the Periodic Table in Chemistry to make it more concise and clear: "The periodic table, which is a tabular arrangement of chemical elements, is organized on the basis of atomic number, electron configuration, and recurring chemical properties. Elements are listed generally in order of increasing atomic number - which corresponds to the number of protons in an atom's atomic nucleus. Rows are arranged so that elements with similar properties fall into the same vertical columns ("groups")."

The periodic table is a tabular arrangement of chemical elements, organized by atomic number, electron configuration, and recurring chemical properties. Elements are listed in order of increasing atomic number, which corresponds to the number of protons in an atom's nucleus. Rows are arranged so that elements with similar properties are in the same vertical columns, known as groups.
